description: Sedge (Carex laxiculmis) is a native, perennial plant found in moist open environments, such as wet meadows and along woodland edges. It provides crucial habitat for native wildlife and is a preferred food source for native bees, butterflies, and other beneficial insects. Resilient to pests and diseases, and tolerant of poor regions, Sedge is a reliable and attractive option for landscapers and gardeners alike. Its evergreen flowering stems decked with small dangling flowers provide year-round beauty. With an attractive mounding shape and its ability to tolerate dry soil, Sedge is an amazing plant choice for all types of gardens.
